page.title: 04GRAHAME PARK ESTATE-DEVELOP.
page.content: Grahame Park Estate was built on the runways of the old Hendon Aerodrome and named after Claude Grahame White, the aviator who started the aerodrome. The Estate was built by Barnet and the GLC to provide homes for 10,000 people from Barnet and from over_crowded Inner London areas. In 1971 the first tenants moved in. Part of it is council homes and part privately owned houses. There are flats, maisonettes, terraced, semi_detached and detached houses. Most of the buildings are brick, sometimes covered with plastic or red_painted gravel which make them more waterproof.The flats are up to eight stories high with glass walkways and a balcony for each flat.I live on the ground floor and share a bedroom with my Mum.If I stand at the window I can see a school and in the distance I can see the M1 motorway.
